title: Explosion at mosque in Afghanistan kills and wounds at least 100
The Facebook outage forced us to take a social media break. Experts say we should do it more often
description: For nearly six hours on Monday, the world experienced a forced break from Facebook's social networking tools.

title: 136 countries agree to minimum corporate tax rate after Ireland drops its opposition
description: Ireland has dropped its opposition to a global treaty that would tax large multinationals at a minimum rate of 15% and require companies to pay taxes in the countries where they make money.

title: Afrobeats star Tiwa Savage says she's being blackmailed over a sex tape
description: Tiwa Savage, the award-winning Nigerian singer-songwriter, says she's being blackmailed over some intimate footage she filmed with her current boyfriend.

title: These people quit their jobs during the pandemic. Here's what they're doing now
Andy Murray is back in the 'good books' after finding lost wedding ring
description: Andy Murray is back in the "good books" after tracking down the wedding ring he lost when his trainers went missing earlier this week.

title: Tennis star Andy Murray has been reunited with his shoes and wedding ring
description: "They still stink, but the shoes are back," said a relieved Murray, after updating his followers about his lost items. The tennis player's trainers — and his wedding ring, which was tied to them — were taken from underneath his car.

title: US judge recommends Cristiano Ronaldo rape case be dismissed
description: A federal judge in Nevada has recommended that the rape case involving Manchester United forward Cristiano Ronaldo be dismissed.

title: 'This is rape': Anti-vax protesters yell at parents walking masked kids to school in LA
description: At a "walk your kid to school" event at a local Los Angeles school, anti-vaccine mandate protesters confront parents and children. Samuel Braslow, a reporter for the the Beverly Hills Courier, joins John Berman to discuss what happened.

title: The Countess of Wessex is getting real about menopause. Why her groundbreaking message matters
description: When Meghan, Duchess of Sussex opened up about her miscarriage last year, she was widely praised for the bravery she showed. Now, Sophie, the Countess of Wessex and the Queen's daughter-in-law, is speaking about another deeply personal issue riddled with stigma.

title: Woman sentenced to four days in jail for Yellowstone grizzly bear incident
description: A 25-year-old woman from Illinois has been sentenced to four days in federal custody for staying too close to a grizzly bear and her cubs at Yellowstone National Park in Wyoming.

title: Trump DC hotel incurred more than $70 million in losses while Trump was president, documents show
description: Former President Donald Trump racked up more than $70 million in losses over a four-year period from his Washington, DC, hotel, while publicly claiming that the hotel was making more than tens of millions of dollars, according to documents released by the House Oversight Committee.

title: Top jockey Oisin Murphy takes 'full responsibility' after failing breathalyzer test ahead of race
description: Top jockey Oisin Murphy has been stood down from the rest of his races on Friday after he revealed he had tested over the drink riding limit.

title: Nobel winner Dmitry Muratov's newspaper has long been a thorn in Putin's side
description: Russian investigative newspaper Novaya Gazeta — whose editor-in-chief Dmitry Muratov won the Nobel Peace Prize on Friday — built its reputation as an outpost of the free press in part for its fearless reporting on the conflict in Chechnya, the former breakaway region in southern Russia.

title: Senator Schumer slams Republicans: They played a risky and partisan game
description: Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer (D-NY) slammed Republicans for playing a 'partisan game' just minutes after the body voted to temporarily raise the debt limit to keep the US from defaulting on it's debts.

title: Nicki Minaj really is going to host 'Real Housewives of Potomac' reunion
description: Months after teasing her involvement in the "Real Housewives of Potomac" reunion, Nicki Minaj has confirmed that she will indeed be taking over hosting duties from Andy Cohen.

title: Health care collapse in Afghanistan threatens lives of millions
description: Health care in Afghanistan has literally collapsed in a matter of months, disrupted by conflict and starved of foreign assistance, according to UN agencies and NGOs working in the country. Thousands of medical staff have not been paid in six months and clinics have no medicine or equipment.

title: Bannon to defy subpoena from Jan 6 committee as Trump urges defiance: sources
description: At least two associates of former President Donald Trump have responded to the House committee investigating the January 6 insurrection -- with one saying they intend to defy the subpoena, according to two sources familiar with the matter.

title: Bond ratings: The best and worst of 007 as 'No Time to Die' marks Daniel Craig's exit
description: Some 007 math: 60 years, 25 movies (with a small asterisk) and six James Bonds. For a Cold War creation, Ian Fleming's suave spy has certainly gotten around, but despite different guises in the tuxedo and occasional scuba gear, when it comes to Bond ratings, there really shouldn't be much argument about who wore it best.

title: Avlon: GOP is using the most pathetic kind of legalese
description: CNN's John Avlon looks at the Republican response to the Senate Judiciary Report "Subverting Justice" and how they continually bury their heads in the sand when it comes to former President Donald Trump and the January 6th insurrection, in this Reality Check.

title: The woman keeping her language alive, one pupil at a time
description: Linda Yuen Lambrecht stands in front of a webcam, with her head to her hips -- her signing space -- perfectly centered in the frame; a white plumeria fastened above her left ear. On screen, three women look back at her.

title: Issa Rae says she was told to include a White character in her shows to make audiences care
description: Issa Rae has spoken out about the lack of diversity in TV, revealing that she was once advised to always include a White character in her shows to ensure the project would "blow up."

title: Independents have turned on Joe Biden
description: President Joe Biden won the 2020 election in large part because he was able to win the center. He emerged with a 13-point win with independent voters, a group that Democratic presidential nominee Hillary Clinton lost by 4 points in 2016. (House Democratic candidates, for their part, took independents by 9 points in 2020.)

title: LEGO to release a 9,090-piece scale model of the Titanic -- its biggest set ever
description: Historians and nautical enthusiasts might want to get saving. LEGO has revealed its largest ever set, of arguably the world's most famous boat, the RMS Titanic.

title: Potential financial Armageddon delayed by two months
description: The Senate voted along party lines to raise the debt ceiling on Thursday, authorizing $480 billion in borrowing that avoids a looming US government default but sets up another showdown in early December.

title: What to know about Europe's newest airline
description: There's a week to go before the world's newest airline launches, and it's promising to bring some dolce vita back to the skies.

title: Nobel winner Maria Ressa vows to fight for facts and the rule of law
description: For journalist Maria Ressa, reporting the news has always been the priority. But the newly honored Nobel Peace Prize winner says she has been forced to "become the news" simply because of her determination to do the job properly and defend the rule of law.

title: Draft bill seeks to introduce some of harshest anti-LGBTQ laws in Africa
description: • This draft bill gives LGBTQ members 2 options: Jail time or conversion therapy

title: Poland ignites EU anger with ruling that its laws supersede bloc's treaties
description: A ruling by Poland's highest court that European Union rules are subordinate to Polish law is an "attack" against the 27-member bloc, France's European Affairs Minister Clement Beaune said on Friday.

title: Brian Laundrie was being monitored before he disappeared, police reveal
China orders coal mines to increase production as power shortages bite
description: China has ordered its coal mines to ramp up production in a bid to ease a power crisis, as the country struggles to balance its need for electricity with efforts to tackle the climate crisis.

title: Damaged US Navy sub was operating in one of world's most difficult undersea environments, analysts say
description: The US Navy submarine that struck an underwater object in the South China Sea last weekend was operating in one of the world's most difficult undersea environments, one filled with noise from ships above and a seabed with constantly shifting contours that can surprise any submarine crew, analysts say.

title: I've spent my life fighting for human rights -- and the job is not done
description: Time is a funny thing. Not so long ago, it seems, I was an Indian girl, coming of age under the South African apartheid regime. Now I am 80 and apartheid is history, but challenges remain. The country is not yet an equal society -- economically or politically.

title: Edge-of-space balloon trips to cost $50,000
description: What do you do for ultimate bragging rights when you've already visited the Grand Canyon, the Great Barrier Reef, the Serengeti and the Giza Pyramids?

title: Riverside restaurant makes waves in Thailand as flood dining goes viral
description: Riverside restaurant owner Titiporn Jutimanon was convinced a bout of flooding in Thailand could be the end of a business already struggling from the pandemic.

title: UN ends Yemen war crimes probe in defeat for Western states
description: Bahrain, Russia and other members of the UN Human Rights Council pushed through a vote on Thursday to shut down the body's war crimes investigations in Yemen, in a stinging defeat for Western states who sought to keep the mission going.

title: Red Bull Stone Scramble: Mud, mayhem, mountain racing and a girl named Mia Chapman
description: On a wild, woodland hilltop in northeastern Tennessee, a man in a gold jacket and matching cowboy hat paces a broad patch of dirt, gesturing up to an increasingly moody sky. "Are y'all ready for some racing?" he bellows into the microphone in his hand.

title: Hong Kong prioritized opening to China over the rest of the world. Now it's stuck in Covid limbo
description: Almost two years into the Covid-19 pandemic, some of the world's major business hubs are reopening as travel restrictions relax and daily life resumes, from New York to London and Paris.

title: Want to go to space in a balloon? You could for $50,000
description: World View is offering the trip of a lifetime -- the opportunity to go to the edge of space. With tickets starting at $50,000, the price-tag is significantly lower than other offerings.

title: Bannon to defy subpoena from January 6 committee as Trump urges defiance, sources say
Dramatic images show Hong Kong scaffolding collapse
description: According to local media, two construction workers are trapped after a large scaffold collapsed next to a high rise in Hong Kong's Happy Valley residential area. The structure fell as heavy rain and wind batter the city, which is under a tropical cyclone warning.

title: Meet the K-pop stars taking on the art world
description: At first glance, the three names beside a series of surreal high-contrast paintings, moody black and white photographs and Jackson Pollock-esque splatters might not jump out among over 70 artists appearing at a London art fair next week.

title: 'Squid Game' director on season 2: 'There are things I haven't explained'
description: Hwang Dong-hyuk, creator of Netflix phenomenon "Squid Game," reveals some facts you may not know about the series, including his thoughts on season two. Warning, spoilers ahead.
